api

Class APICall

  • java.lang.Object
    • api.APICall

  • public class APICall
extends java.lang.Object
    Class APICall - Overrides HTTP API method calling.
    Version:
    3.0beta
    Author:
    Martin Rios - SysAdmin and Professional Computer Technician

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      APICall()

    • Method Detail

      • send

        public void send(java.lang.String host)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Send request to server and save it, using GET method.
        Parameters:
        host - API's URL.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If HTTP method doesn't exist, host/method are empty, URL is malformed or HTTP's response is not 200 (OK)

      • send

        public void send(java.lang.String host,
                 java.lang.String method)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Send request to server and save it, using any method.
        Parameters:
        host - API's URL.
        method - HTTP's method for API's calling.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If HTTP method doesn't exist, host/method are empty, URL is malformed or HTTP's response is not 200 (OK)

      • send

        public void send(java.lang.String host,
                 java.lang.String method,
                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> headers)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Send request to server and save it, using methods and headers. Headers are presented as Map. You can use any subclass which implements that interface on this method.
        Parameters:
        host - API's URL.
        method - HTTP's method for API's calling.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If HTTP method doesn't exist, host/method are empty, URL is malformed or HTTP's response is not 200 (OK)
        See Also:
        Map

      • send

        public void send(java.lang.String host,
                 java.lang.String method,
                 android.os.Bundle headers)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Only for Android developers. Send request to server and save it, using methods and headers. Headers are presented as Bundle. Bundle is an Android OS' class for using key/value pairs.
        Parameters:
        host - API's URL.
        method - HTTP's method for API's calling.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If HTTP method doesn't exist, host/method are empty, URL is malformed or HTTP's response is not 200 (OK)
        See Also:
        Bundle

      • receive

        public java.lang.String receive()
        Get saved response from API-calling.
        Returns:
        Server's response from API.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Get current data from API.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string containing data received from API called previously by send(), or null if there's no API called.
